citations.narrative:
Three rooms with free roaming cats had exposed active electrical cords within reach of the animals. Electrical cords can
pose a health hazard to animals that may pull or chew on them. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained
so that they protect the cats from injury. Correct by 10/08/2025.

The enclosure housing the singly housed chicken did not contain any shade structure to protect the bird from the sun.
Without adequate shade structures the chicken may experience discomfort from prolonged sun exposure which may
negatively impact the animal’s health and well-being. Shelters must have one or more separate areas of shade or other
effective protection to prevent their discomfort from direct sunlight. Correct by 10/04/2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The following issues were identified with the facility’s enrichment plan for the chicken:
- The enclosure did not contain a perch to allow for roosting which an important natural chicken behavior.
- The documented enrichment plan did not include specific provisions to address the social needs of the chicken.
- The plan also did not describe the special attention regarding enhancement to the environment provided to this
individually housed social species of bird that is unable to see and hear birds of its own or compatible species
A detailed and adequately implemented enrichment plan is necessary to ensure that the overall health, well-being, and
psychological needs of the birds are being appropriately met. The facility must develop, document, and follow a species-
appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of chickens. The plan
must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special
considerations, restraint devices, and exemptions.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
